category.name: Family Prayers
category.description: Prayers for family devotion and spiritual growth

content.text:
God, I know you listen,
So teach me how to really pray.
I'll be honestâ€”sometimes when I'm praying,
my words and my heart aren't in the same place.
I admit I've thrown your name around casually,
a name that deserves nothing but respect.
I've wanted things that would have only hurt me,
and I've taken my biggest blessings for granted.
I've been wrong about what to hope for and what to fear.
I'm not qualified to choose for myself;
I don't know how to direct my own life.

Let your Spirit help me in my weakness,
because I don't even know what I should be praying for.
Help me to want the right things so I can actually ask for them;
then I'll know for sure that you hear me.

Help me not to get caught up begging for temporary things,
but to always trust them to your loving care,
since you know what I need before I even ask.
Let me never define success by anything but the health of my soul,
or think I'm rich unless I'm rich in You,
or believe I'm smart unless I have the wisdom that leads to real life.

Help me to put your Kingdom and your way of doing things first.
Help me to see things from an eternal perspective.
Let my spiritual health be my number one priority.

I would rather be poor, hurting, and rejected but have your blessing,
than to be a huge success,
have more than I could ever dream of,
or be popular with everyone,
if all of that makes me forget you.

Help me see the world's promises for what they often are: a fantasy, a lie, empty, and a source of stress,
and help me to rise above it.
And let me find my true happiness in knowing you approve of me, in becoming more like you, in your presence, and in serving you.
